definition: surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: The meeting was brought to a climax by the appearance on the platform of the rebel leader.
sentences.chinese: 起義軍的領袖出現在臺上時會議達到了高潮。

sentences.english: After a prolonged siege, the town was rendered up to the insurgents.
sentences.chinese: 經過長時間包圍之後，這個小鎮已被起義軍攻克。

sentences.english: Artoo was refurbished in time for the celebration of the Rebel victory.
sentences.chinese: R2被及時修理後，參加了起義軍的勝利慶典。

sentences.english: Jabba's enforcers were no match for a group of determined Rebels led by a Jedi Knight.
sentences.chinese: 賈巴的打手無法與絕地武士領導的頑強義軍相匹敵。

sentences.english: Their plan worked and the city was eventually liberated by the Alliance.
sentences.chinese: 他們的計劃取得了成功，雲城最後被義軍同盟解放。

sentences.english: Later, the two hunters schemed to capture the stranded crew of 90 Rebels.
sentences.chinese: 隨後，二人策劃俘獲落難的90名起義軍船員。

sentences.english: He said the opposition was open to foreign troops training rebel fighters.
sentences.chinese: 他說起義軍歡迎外國友軍訓練起義軍的戰士們。

sentences.english: He said the opposition was open to foreign troops training rebel fighters.
sentences.chinese: 他說起義軍歡迎外國友軍訓練起義軍的戰士們。

sentences.english: The insurrectionary army laid siege to the capital.
Rebel attack state G group, single.
sentences.chinese: 起義軍攻州克羣，屢戰屢勝。

sentences.english: It comes amid concern about the possibility of fragmentation of rebel forces after toppling Col Gaddafi.
sentences.chinese: 此言是爲了平抑大家對於卡倒臺後義軍分裂的憂慮。

sentences.english: It was imperative that the president get a message to the leader of the insurgents.
sentences.chinese: 總統急需將一條消息傳給起義軍的首領。

sentences.english: Kenobi's death strengthened Skywalker's resolve to serve both the Rebellion and the Force.
sentences.chinese: 克諾比的死加強了天行者投身義軍同盟和原力的決心。

sentences.english: Farmboy. Pilot. Rebel. Jedi. Grand Master. Father.
sentences.chinese: 農夫，起義軍飛行員，絕地宗師，父親。

sentences.english: The leaders of the insurrectionary army beat up the newly captured town for recruits.
sentences.chinese: 起義軍的首領們在新攻佔的城裏四出奔走，招募新兵。

sentences.english: And meanwhile, they fortified the place and stationed army there to strengthen their military control.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時還設置砦堡和駐守義軍土兵，加強軍事控制。

definition: Zhang Xianzhong (1606-1647), leader of a late-Ming peasant revolt
armed enemy of the nation/enemy of the Emperor/fig. championship challenger/contender opposing champion in sporting contest
to go on a punitive expedition

same as 舊唐書|旧唐书[Jiu4 Tang2 shu1], History of the Early Tang Dynasty, sixteenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Liu Xu 劉昫|刘昫[Liu2 Xu4] in 945 during Later Jin 後晉|后晋[Hou4 Jin4] of the Five Dynasties, 200 scrolls
commander-in-chief, the equivalent of king in Chinese chess
Hunan army, irregular force formed in 1850s to fight the Taiping heavenly kingdom rebellion
Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
